Friend and Lord Almeida Salso, December 18, 1842

If Your Mercy knows, I ask Inácio for Uncle Bento in order to give his protection, just as I write to Senhor Fontoura, from whom I suppose nothing will be done on this side; Your Mercy has with you Bento had given me to pass letters of the rights that I had to pay, whose order was now contradicted at the Erval Collection, I do not know if by the Minister or the Inspector, and that nothing would be credited to me without a positive order from the government. Therefore, my friend, who is, as I am, with my small fortune sacrificed, and Your Mercy Your Mercy

Your slaves it has not been possible to hear news of them, and about your yacht in the last letters I had from Vicente nothing had been arranged yet.

I continue to assure you that whenever I engage in your service, it will satisfy those who are

Your constant and faithful friend Antônio Francisco dos Santos Abreu

Post scriptum I beg you very much for the promptness of this my matter, since soon I will need to present the order or pay the rights in money.
